alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 12:00AM CDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Choctaw, Washington and Clarke Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and reach a crest of 33.4 feet early Sunday morning. It will remain above flood stage through Tuesday. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mob. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
